intro: Sinosenecio ovatifolius, commonly known as the broad-leafed sinosenecio, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features lanceolate to ovate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It produces yellow flowers that are arranged in dense, spherical clusters, making it visually striking. Sinosenecio ovatifolius is often found in rocky or mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
